Sentencas: Ion conducting oxides are commonly used as electrolytes in electrochemical devices including solid oxide fuel cells and oxygen sensors.
Titulo: Enhanced Oxygen Exchange on Surface-Engineered Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia

Sentencas: A typical issue with these oxide electrolytes is sluggish oxygen surface kinetics at the gas - electrolyte interface.
Titulo: Enhanced Oxygen Exchange on Surface-Engineered Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia

Sentencas: An approach to overcome this sluggish kinetics Is by engineering the oxide surface with a lower oxygen incorporation barrier.
Titulo: Enhanced Oxygen Exchange on Surface-Engineered Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia

Sentencas: In this study, we engineered the surface doping concentration of a common oxide electrolyte, yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ), with the help of atomic layer deposition (AID).
Titulo: Enhanced Oxygen Exchange on Surface-Engineered Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia

Sentencas: On optimizing the dopant concentration at the surface of single-crystal YSZ, a 5-fold increase in the oxygen surface exchange coefficient of the electrolyte was observed using isotopic oxygen exchange experiments coupled with secondary ion mass spectrometer measurements.
Titulo: Enhanced Oxygen Exchange on Surface-Engineered Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia

Sentencas: The results demonstrate that electrolyte surface engineering with ALD can have a meaningful Impact on the performance of electrochemical devices.
Titulo: Enhanced Oxygen Exchange on Surface-Engineered Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia
